channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Venezuela Frees Over 130 People Imprisoned After Disputed Election
item.description: Experts say the release of some political prisoners may be an attempt by Venezuela’s autocrat to send a signal to President-elect Trump.

item.title: No, Trump Cannot Run for Re-election Again in 2028
item.description: The Constitution sets a two-term limit for presidents. Still, Donald J. Trump has repeatedly floated the idea that he might like to stay in the White ...

item.title: Airbnb is offering wannabe gladiators the chance to play-fight in Rome’s Colosseum. Romans aren’t happy about that
Exclusive: Menopause startup Alloy raises $16 million
item.description: Monica Molenaar and Anne Fulenwider cofounded Alloy four years ago.

item.title: Israeli Strikes in Beirut’s Center Shatter a Tenuous Sense of Security
item.description: The strikes, the first in weeks inside Lebanon’s capital, forced residents to come to grips with another escalation of fighting between Israel and Hez...

item.title: Burglars Break Into Windsor Castle Estate, Home of Prince William, Kate and Family
item.description: The intruders entered a farm building on the castle estate last month and stole an Isuzu pickup and a quad bike, according to the local police.

item.title: Pete Hegseth Has One Thing Going for Him as Trump’s Defense Secretary Pick
item.description: Pete Hegseth may not be qualified, but his nomination at least represents a legitimate policy change after over 20 years of failed wars.

item.title: Ukraine Is Poised to Strike Into Russia After Biden Approves Use of Long-Range Missiles
item.description: President Biden has granted permission for Kyiv to carry out long-range strikes, and his Ukrainian counterpart said the launches would come soon.

item.title: Thomson Reuters CEO: With changes to U.S. policy likely, here’s what to expect for AI in business and government
item.description: Sitting out a tech revolution is simply not an option, writes Thomson Reuters CEO Steve Hasker.

item.title: Venezuela Frees Over 130 People Imprisoned After Disputed Election
item.description: Experts say the release of some political prisoners may be an attempt by Venezuela’s autocrat to send a signal to President-elect Trump.

item.title: Beirut Residents Reel Under Fresh Round of Israeli Airstrikes
item.description: In the first strikes on Beirut for weeks, at least 10 people were killed and 45 more injured according to Lebanon’s health ministry.

item.title: Elon Musk’s endorsement of a Treasury secretary candidate has reportedly rubbed Trump’s people the wrong way
item.description: Musk's post on X appears to put pressure on Trump.

item.title: Ukraine Is Poised to Strike Into Russia After Biden Approves Use of Long-Range Missiles
item.description: President Biden has granted permission for Kyiv to carry out long-range strikes, and his Ukrainian counterpart said the launches would come soon.

item.title: Tesla jumps as Elon Musk’s ‘bet for the ages’ on Trump is seen paying off with federal self-driving rules
item.description: Tesla stock jumped after a report said Trump's transition team is prioritizing the creation of federal framework for fully autonomous cars.

item.title: Israeli Strikes in Beirut’s Center Shatter a Tenuous Sense of Security
